text: [Dave]: I saw Erin heading towards the engine room a few minutes ago.
[Erin]: That's not true, Dave. I've been in Cafeteria with Alice, Bob, and Charlie. We were all doing tasks.
[Bob]: Dave, where exactly were you when you "saw" Erin heading to the engine room?
[Charlie]: Dave, if you saw Erin go to the engine room, then you weren't in the cafeteria when Alice was killed, so where were you?
[Dave]: I was near the entrance to the cafeteria, finishing up a task, when I briefly saw Erin heading towards the engine room hallway; I assumed she was going to electrical.
[Erin]: Dave, if you were near the cafeteria entrance finishing a task, you would have seen someone kill Alice – who was it?
[Bob]: Dave, your story keeps changing – first you were near the entrance, now you're saying you were *in* the cafeteria briefly, which is it?
[Charlie]: Dave, you still haven't explained how you could see Erin leaving the cafeteria if you were inside it, so who did you see kill Alice?

[Dave]: My apologies, I misspoke again; I was near the cafeteria entrance, saw Erin heading towards Electrical, then briefly entered the cafeteria, and then left towards Weapons, so I didn't see who killed Alice.

[Erin]: Dave, you've changed your story multiple times now – first you were near the cafeteria, then inside, then near the entrance again, and now you're adding Weapons to the mix; who else did you see near the cafeteria or in the hallways?
[Bob]: Dave, you've now added Weapons to your story, making it even more convoluted and unbelievable – can you explain why your story keeps changing with each question?
[Charlie]: Dave, you seem awfully flustered and your story is full of holes – are you sure *you're* not the impostor?
[Dave]: Look, I'm getting flustered because you're all ganging up on me! I saw Erin leave, then I went to check Weapons for a task; it's a simple explanation.
[Erin]: Dave, your constantly changing story makes you look suspicious – it's time to vote you out.
[Bob]: Dave, you said you went to Weapons to check for a task, but you still haven't told us *which* task you were checking for, so it's clearly a lie to cover up your guilt.
[Charlie]: Dave, you've avoided answering a simple question multiple times now: what specific task were you checking for in Weapons?
[Dave]: The task I was looking for in Weapons was "Clear Asteroids," it sometimes appears there, and with all the commotion, I forgot to mention it.
[Erin]: Dave, "Clear Asteroids" is *never* a task in Weapons; it's always in Navigation, so you're lying.
[Bob]: Dave, claiming "Clear Asteroids" is in Weapons proves you're lying, and combined with your constantly shifting story about the cafeteria, it's time to vote you out.
[Charlie]: Dave, "Clear Asteroids" is *always* in Navigation, so you're clearly lying and trying to deflect suspicion.
